name: The Book Reporter
description: A zine collecting excerpts from eight of the year's finest book reports about fake books. The cover of each book is reproduced in glorious full-color next to the report. Visit this link here for more preview images 4.25"x5.5" Cardstock cover, color and bw interior. Colors of covers may vary from those pictured. Hear me reading a few selections here.

name: Cross My Words and Hope to ___ (VERB). #3
description: The third issue of the world's only crossword puzzle/mad lib/coloring book literary zine. Fill in the blanks in stories and poems mad-lib style, or read the pieces as they were originally written by finding answers to seven crossword puzzles. Dinosaurs are hand-colored, so yours might not be exactly like the one pictured. Click here for more info.

name: The Mongoosnuffle Song & Dance Book
description: Would you like to have a kitten named Mr. Mongoosnuffles? I would, but I already have two cats with funny names. So instead of getting a kitten and naming him Mr. Mongoosnuffles, I wrote a song about wanting a kitten called "The Mongoosnuffle Shuffle Rag." Then I choreographed a dance. Then I made the whole thing into a zine for you to enjoy. (And soon, a music video!) The Mongoosnuffle Song & Dance Book includes the story of Mister Mongoosnuffles, lyrics for "The Mongoosnuffle Shuffle Rag" illustrated with paper cutouts, fake-book style sheet music for the song, and illustrated instructions on how to dance the Mongoosnuffle Shuffle. This is a kid-friendly project, but the intended audience is silly people of all ages. Click here for more images.

name: Would You Drink a Soda...
description: Would you drink a soda that was made of soda water and blueberries and cumin? What about potatoes and mice? Coconut and honey? Explore your deep-seated feelings about sodas, learn about and create exciting new flavors, and discuss which ones you would be willing to drink. Each page is a hand-crafted masterpiece of soda art - alternating between original paper cutouts and watercolor paintings of craft-brewed imaginary sodas. 10 pages 4.25"x5.5" full color Go here to see a few more preview images. Please email me for shipping outside the US. emily@emilyaldenfoster.com

name: Cross My Words and Hope to _____ (VERB), #2
description: The second issue of my crossword puzzle/mad lib/literary zine. Fill in the blanks in the stories and poems with designated parts of speech to read wacky mad libs. OR solve the crossword puzzles to find the words that the authors intended to go in the blanks. This one has seven puzzles instead of one big puzzle! Writing by Keith Ecker, Channing Kennedy, Gregg Lewis, Jacqueline Suskin, Allen Talbert, Barbara Jean Walsh, and Rachel Weiner. Artwork by Emily Alden Foster, Jessica James Lansdon, and Jennie Yim. Crossword puzzles by Emily Alden Foster. 8.5" x 7" Hand-colored covers - colors vary. Click here for more info.
